PostTrial: ^I can't believe it, Anna, you really did it...
^I've been so hopeless for the last few days, thinking my entire life and career was over, but what you did was truly a miracle.
^You did great, Boss! All the times you were telling Arthur Splanoir off was so badass!
^If I ever get in a tacky case like this, I'm SO coming to you to represent me.
^But it would probably be so much easier than today, because I'm not a celebrity, and won't have Arthur Splanoir tailing me.
^I'm glad things turned out this way. I couldn't have done it without all of your guys' help.
^I'm proud of you, Anna. I'm glad to have helped.
^Ms. Kanna may have been found innocent, but the case is not over.
^I have agreed to represent Eileen Lore on her plea for self-defense. The trial will probably be in a few weeks, or days if I'm unlucky.
^Boss, you're quite the busy woman. It seems like you have cases constantly coming at you one after the other, but you just tackled a huge one!
^You should give yourself a break. Hey, if you guys are free, let's go get Korean barbecue and go for some karaoke!
^I'd be more than down! That sounds like a great way to end such a stressful day.
^Just know that because I'm paying for it, I'm not going easy on you for karaoke.
^Nadine agreed, so you guys HAVE to come now! Maybe we'll play one of her songs!
^Oh dear, that would be funny. I'd like to see you sing them.
^Hey, do you doubt me or something? What's that one called again, the one that goes: �Na-na-na-na...�
^Those two seem to get along really well. And for once, I agree with Diego.
^I know you told Eileen you are willing to represent her, but you have plenty of time to prepare.
^You need to take some time off and reward yourself with some fun. I don't say I'm proud of you for no reason.
^You're right. The karaoke thing does sound exciting. But you'd be coming too, right?
^As the head of the crime lab, I have a lot of responsibilities. The lab is constantly busy, and I've already used up a lot of time attending this trial.
^But maybe for you, I can make an exception.
^It's been a while since we've even gone out. I appreciate you a lot, Christina.
^Okay, me and Nadine just booked the reservation for dinner and karaoke. Let's start heading out!
